skill.name: scientific-writing
skill.description: Core skill for the deep research and writing tool. Write scientific manuscripts in full paragraphs (never bullet points). Use two-stage process: (1) create section outlines with key points using research-lookup, (2) convert to flowing prose. IMRAD structure, citations (APA/AMA/Vancouver), figures/tables, reporting guidelines (CONSORT/STROBE/PRISMA), for research papers and journal submissions.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown reference files providing scientific writing guidance. No file access, network operations, or code execution capabilities detected.

content.user_title: Draft scientific papers with structured guidance
content.value_statement: Scientific manuscripts require careful structure, accurate citations, and compliance with reporting standards. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for IMRAD sections, citation formatting, and journal-specific requirements to help researchers produce publication-ready manuscripts.
actual_capabilities: Guide IMRAD section structure and flow for scientific manuscripts
Provide citation format guidance for APA, AMA, Vancouver, Chicago, and IEEE styles
Apply reporting guideline checklists such as CONSORT, STROBE, and PRISMA
Advise on figures and tables selection, design, and formatting
Convert research outlines into full paragraph prose using a two-stage process
Adapt writing style to match target journal requirements
limitations: Does not perform literature searches without the research-lookup skill
Does not generate figures without the scientific-schematics skill
Does not validate statistical analyses or verify raw data accuracy
Does not submit manuscripts to journals or interact with publication systems

use_cases.title: Structure thesis article
use_cases.description: Transform draft notes into a complete IMRAD manuscript with clear section guidance and proper formatting.

use_cases.title: Prepare trial report
use_cases.description: Apply CONSORT guidelines and citation style requirements to write a clinical study paper for medical journal submission.

use_cases.title: Improve clarity and style
use_cases.description: Refine manuscript wording and consistency to match journal expectations and scientific writing standards.

prompt_templates.title: Plan an IMRAD outline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an IMRAD outline for a study on sleep and cognition. List key points and identify needed citations for each section.

prompt_templates.title: Draft an introduction
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a two-paragraph Introduction on AI in radiology. Include APA-style in-text citations as placeholders.

prompt_templates.title: Apply reporting checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my Methods section for STROBE completeness and list any missing items requiring addition.

prompt_templates.title: Revise for journal style
prompt_templates.prompt: Rewrite this Discussion to match a clinical journal tone while improving clarity without changing meaning.

output_examples.input: Rewrite this Results section for clarity and integrate figure references.
output: Rewritten Results section in flowing prose with smooth transitions between findings
Figure references naturally integrated where data is presented
Statistics stated with effect sizes, confidence intervals, and appropriate context

best_practices: Provide your target journal name and required citation style at the start of each session
Share a brief outline or key points before requesting full prose drafts
State your study design so the correct reporting guideline checklist is applied
anti_patterns: Requesting final manuscripts as bullet lists instead of flowing paragraphs
Asking for citations without specifying which citation style to use
Omitting study design details that are needed for accurate methods guidance

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is model-agnostic and works across Claude, Codex, and Claude Code platforms.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this writing skill?
faq.answer: It provides writing guidance only and does not perform literature searches, generate figures, or verify data.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with other scientific skills?
faq.answer: Yes. It pairs with research-lookup for source gathering and scientific-schematics for creating figures.

faq.question: Does the skill access my files or credentials?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill with no file access, network operations, or credential requirements.

faq.question: What if my output lacks flow or clarity?
faq.answer: Provide the target section and audience details, then request a revision focused on clarity and coherence.

faq.question: How does this differ from generic writing helpers?
faq.answer: It focuses specifically on IMRAD structure, scientific style conventions, citation formats, and reporting guidelines.
